author: Special Correspondent
text:
With a view to equipping its students with knowledge of a foreign language to improve their chances of employability, Manonmaniam Sundaranar University here will soon start a Centre for International Languages on its premises.

“Since Asian countries such as Japan and South Korea have established their industrial clusters in various parts of the country and China, Germany and France consider India as a manufacturing hub, we’ve decided to teach our students Japanese, Korean, French, Chinese and German through the proposed facility to give them an edge over others in the highly-competitive job market,” Vice-Chancellor K. Baskar told reporters here on Wednesday.

Prof. Baskar, who is proficient in Tamil, English, Telugu and Japanese, firmly believes that knowledge of a foreign language would fetch them good jobs in the manufacturing hubs being established in the country by the Asian and European countries. The university would initiate discussion with consulates or embassies of those countries on modalities for establishing the centre on the lines of a similar facility functioning at Anna University in Chennai.

The Vice-Chancellor said that the university would have tie-up with leading foreign universities and industries to bring foreign students and projects. “The 1.32 lakh Indian students studying in the universities of United States spend anywhere around Rs. 8,000 crore every year as tuition fee. If we can improve our infrastructure and the curriculum, we can also attract foreign students and projects,” Prof. Baskar said.

The MSU would facilitate students’ exchange programme with foreign universities, he said.
title: Centre for International Languages at MSU soon
